document.docTitle: Tainarys myracrodrui Burckhardt & Queiroz, 2017, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: The jumping plant-lice of the Neotropical genus Tainarys (Hemiptera: Psylloidea) associated with Anacardiaceae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The jumping plant-lice of the Neotropical genus Tainarys (Hemiptera: Psylloidea) associated with Anacardiaceae

Description. Adult. Colouration. Head and thorax dirty whitish to ochreous, with dark brown pattern. Vertex with a large patch in the middle of each half, a longitudinal streak along the midline, and each a transverse line near and at the foremargin, respectively. Antennal insertions and eyes with dark margins. Clypeus light in the middle, brown otherwise. Antenna whitish, with apices of segments 4, 6 and 8 as well as entire segments 1, 8 and 9 dark brown. Thorax with a fine dark line in the middle and two broader dark lines sublaterally. Legs dirty whitish with dark brown dots. Forewing semi-transparent, light yellowish with brown dots covering the whole membrane; wing membrane along apical margin light brown, with dark dots denser ( Figs 2 , 10 ). Apices of veins Rs, M1+2, M3+4, Cu1a and Cu1b with a dark dot each. Hindwing semi-transparent, whitish. Abdomen yellowish, with dark brown sclerites; terminalia ochreous, brown at base. Young specimens with less extended dark colour.

Structure. Vertex ( Figs 38 , 52 ) 1.6 times as wide as long, surface finely punctured; genae evenly curved down; frons small, rectangular. Antenna ( Fig. 66 ) with one subapical rhinarium on each of segments 4, 6, 8 and 9; segments 5 and 7 slightly thinner than other flagellar segments; relative length of antennal flagellar segments = 1.0/ 0.8/ 0.7/ 0.5/ 0.7/ 0.8/ 0.7/ 0.7; segment 3 shorter than segments 4 and 5 together; segment 10 with longer terminal seta about 1.1 times as long as segment and shorter seta about 0.7 times as long. Clypeus strongly subglobular. Pronotum transverse, long, about 5 times as wide as long. Meso- and metascutellum transverse, weakly raised. Metacoxa ( Fig. 82 ) with meracanthus small, tubercular and with a conical, weakly curved membranous process on the trochanteral cavity; metatibia with an open crown of 6 apical sclerotised spurs. Forewing ( Figs 2 , 10 ) rhomboidal, apex broadly symmetrically rounded; vein C+Sc concave, slender; vein Rs strongly curved backwards; vein M1+2 curved backwards; membrane semi-transparent; surface spinules ( Fig. 24 ) densely spaced, covering whole wing membrane up to veins; radular spinules forming narrow, ill-defined bands along wing margin in cell m1, m2, and cu1. Terminalia as in Figs 91 , 104 , 117 , 130 , 142 . Male subgenital plate, in profile, subrectangular with angular dorsal margin. Paramere with posterior lobe; inner face bearing a group of weakly sclerotised thickened setae. Distal portion of aedeagus weakly inflated apically. Female proctiger cuneate, subacute apically. Subgenital plate sparsely pilose ventrally.

Measurements (in mm) and ratios ( 6 ♂ , 6 ♀ ). Head width (HW) 0.38–0.42 (0.39±0.02), antenna length (AL) 0.58–0.64 (0.60±0.02), forewing length (WL) 1.48–1.90 (1.67±0.17), metatibia length (TL) 0.40–0.50 (0.45±0.04), male proctiger length (MP) 0.16–0.18 (0.17±0.01), paramere length 0.16, length of distal segment of aedeagus 0.14‒0.16 (0.15±0.01), female proctiger length (FP) 0.36–0.52 (0.44±0.20).—AL/HW 1.43–1.63 (1.53±0.08), WL/ HW 3.89–4.75 (4.24±0.32), WL/forewing width 2.66–2.83 (2.75±0.06), metafemur length/TL 0.58–0.64 (0.61±0.04), TL/HW 1.05–1.25 (1.14±0.07), MP/HW 0.42–0.45 (0.44±0.01), FP/HW 0.86–1.30 (1.08±0.26), FP/ circumanal ring length 2.25–3.71 (2.98±0.85), FP/subgenital plate length 1.06–1.63 (1.34±0.33).

Fifth instar immature ( Fig. 153 ). Colouration. Body whitish to yellowish. Antenna ochreous with apex dark brown to black. Apex of rostrum almost black. Apices of tarsi brown. Abdomen slightly orange.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (in mm) and ratios (3 immatures). Body length (BL) 1.10–1.46 (1.24±0.19), antenna length (AL) 0.54–0.60 (0.57±0.03), forewing pad length (WL) 0.52–0.60 (0.55±0.04), caudal plate length (CPL) 0.28– 0.34 (0.31±0.03), caudal plate width (CPW) 0.46–0.60 (0.52±0.07).—BL/body width 1.38–1.57 (1.44±0.11), WL/ AL 0.96–1.00 (0.98±0.02), CPL/caudal plate width 0.56–0.65 (0.59±0.05), CPW/circumanal ring width 5.75–8.33 (7.19±1.32).

Etymology. Named after
Myracrodruon
, one of its host genera.
Distribution. Brazil ( Distrito Federal , Mato Grosso do Sul , Minas Gerais , São Paulo ).

Host plants.
Astronium graveolens Jacq.
,
Myracrodruon urundeuva Allemão
( Anacardiaceae ).
